service.name: admin.schematrontype
service.documentation:
List the various schematron's and the schematron criteria types.
Schematron Criteria types are used to define the options used to create a schematron criteria.

service.name: admin.schematron.list
service.documentation:
List schematron.
Parameters are: * id: (Optional) The id of a schematron to load

service.name: admin.schematron.exists
service.documentation:
Check for the existance of a schematron
Parameters are: * id: The id of a schematron to check

service.name: admin.schematron.update
service.documentation:
Update properties of a schematron
Parameters are: * id: The id of a schematron to update * displaypriority: the new display priority of the schematron

service.name: admin.schematroncriteria.list
service.documentation:
List schematron criteria.
Parameters are: * id: (Optional) The id of a criteria to load * groupName: (Optional) filter listed criteria to those containing the groupName (it is recommended to be used in conjuction with schematronId) * schematronId: (Optional) filter listed criteria to those containing the schematronId (it is recommended to be used in conjuction with groupName) * includeGroup: (Optional) if true then each criteria will also contain the SchematronCriteriaGroup data
Response is: <schematroncriteria> <record> <group> <!-- if includeGroup is true then the required attribute is also present in group --> <id> <name>*Generated*</name> <schematronid>100</schematronid> </id> </group> <id>101</id> <type>ALWAYS_ACCEPT</type> <value>_ignored_</value> <uitype>ALWAYS_ACCEPT</uitype> <uivalue>_ignored_</uivalue> </record> </schematroncriteria>

service.name: admin.schematroncriteria.exists
service.documentation:
Check for the existence of a SchematronCriteria
Parameters are: * id: The id of a schematron to check
Return is: <response>true</response>

service.name: admin.schematroncriteria.add
service.documentation:
Add a new SchematronCriteria. If the SchematronCriteriaGroup identified by the parameters does not exist a new one will be created.
Parameters are: * groupName: Part 1 of the SchematronCriteriaGroup ID * schematronId: Part 2 of the SchematronCriteriaGroup ID * type: the SchematronCriteriaType identifier (the name of the enum) * value: the value that will be passed when calculating if the criteria is satisfied * uiType: a string for the UI to use as the type for display (for example Keyword instead of XPATH) * uiValue: a string for displaying in the UI instead of value (for example building instead of the xpath expression matching the keyword building)

service.name: admin.schematroncriteria.update
service.documentation:
Edit an existing SchematronCriteria.
Parameters are: * groupName: Part 1 of the SchematronCriteriaGroup ID * schematronId: Part 2 of the SchematronCriteriaGroup ID * type: the SchematronCriteriaType identifier (the name of the enum) * value: the value that will be passed when calculating if the criteria is satisfied

service.name: admin.schematroncriteria.delete
service.documentation:
Delete an existing SchematronCriteria.
Parameters are: * id: the id of the SchematronCriteria to delete

service.name: admin.schematroncriteriagroup.list
service.documentation:
List SchematronCriteriaGroup. To list just one use both groupName and schematronId as they make up the primary key of a SchematronCriteriaGroup.
Parameters are: * groupName: (Optional) filter listed criteria to those containing the groupName (it is recommended to be used in conjuction with schematronId) * schematrongId: (Optional) filter listed criteria to those containing the schematronId (it is recommended to be used in conjuction with groupName) * includeCriteria: (Optional) if true then each criteria data (instead of just the ids) will be included in the group * includeSchematron: (Optional) if true the schematron data (instead of just the ids) will be included in the group
Return is (when includeCriteria and include Schematron are true): <schematroncriteriagroup> <record> <criteria> <!-- if includeCriteria is false then only the criteria id is present --> <criteria> <group /> <id>101</id> <type>ALWAYS_ACCEPT</type> <value>_ignored_</value> </criteria> </criteria> <id> <name>*Generated*</name> <schematronid>100</schematronid> </id> <requirement>REQUIRED</requirement> <!-- Schematron only present when includeSchematron is true --> <schematron> <defaultrequirement>REQUIRED</defaultrequirement> <file>schematron-rules-geonetwork.xsl</file> <id>100</id> <label> <eng>schematron-rules-geonetwork</eng> </label> <rulename>schematron-rules-geonetwork</rulename> <schemaname>iso19139</schemaname> </schematron> </record> <schematroncriteriagroup>
